page.title: 03Farming In Thorpe Hesley.
page.content: Farmers in our area have problems which are caused by having farms surrounded by housing estates.They have difficulties with stray pets and trespassers.There is also pollution from the nearby coking plant.This affects the pig's eyes at the pig farm and to a lesser extent the crops. The farms in our area are mostly dairy farms and they have been affected by the cuts in milk quotas. The animals are given injections to keep them healthy.The worst diseases are T.B.Brucellosis and Foot and Mouth.The Ministry of Agriculture takes blood samples from all cattle every two years to check for these diseases.Houses are being built on good farming land which means that farms cannot be extended.The farms in our area do not use computers for stock control.
